column4: hey, i'm trying to install ubuntu on my netbook while salvaging the windows partition
is it possible?
its possible
can it be done with the ubuntu installer?
what do you want to do just have both windows and linux?
yes. windows is already installed and has a 'ghost' partition in the back to reinstall windows too
the ubuntu installer wont delete your windows paritions unless you tell it to do so
so windows will only be deleted if i delete the partition?
yes, but if you install ubuntus boot loader it will overwrite windows's bootloader by default
and not if i repartition a section of the drive?
if you repartition and leave the windows partition and choose not to format it you wont lose it, is that what you are asking?
yes
well... i backed up everything beforehand so here goes nothing
if i don't install the boot loader, how would add linux to the windows boot loader? (a howto would be nice)
akaik you cant
then i'll use the linux one then
thanx. hopefully it all works. i'll find out in an hour or two
alright
sweet! the install worked better than i expected
the bootloader automatically put windows as an option
it should
